description.en: Seminarikursuse keskmeks on tähtsamad teemad Briti nüüdisproosas. Lugemisele ja arutlusele tulevad valitud autorite teosed, mida analüüsitakse seminaritundides.
description.et: The seminar focuses on key themes in contemporary British fiction. Novels by several British authors will be read, analysed, and discussed in a seminar setting.

objectives.en: The aim of the text-oriented course is to provide a survey of the most significant developments in contemporary British fiction and introduce to students the key themes characteristic of the period. The students will learn to utilize critical concepts relevant to the discussion of texts of contemporary fiction and hone their skills of academic writing and making oral presentations.
objectives.et: Tekstikeskse kursuse eesmärk on anda ülevaade kõige olulisematest suundumustest Briti nüüdisproosas, tutvustades üliõpilastele selle perioodi olulisemaid teemasid. Osalejad õpivad kasutama nüüdisproosatekstide analüüsimiseks vajalikku kriitilist mõistestikku ning lihvivad akadeemilise kirjutamise ja suulise esinemise oskusi.

learning_outcomes.en: Having completed the course the students will
1) have obtained a survey of the most significant developments in contemporary British fiction;
learning_outcomes.et: 1) omavad ülevaadet tähtsamatest suundumustest Briti nüüdisproosas

learning_outcomes.en: 2) be aware of the thematic issues characteristic of the fiction of the period;
learning_outcomes.et: 2) on kursis iseloomulikemate temaatiliste arengutega selle perioodi proosas

learning_outcomes.en: 3) have improved their use of critical terms and concepts relevant to the discussions of contemporary literature
learning_outcomes.et: 3) on tuttavad nüüdiskirjanduse käsitlemisel kasutava kirjandusteadusliku mõistestiku ja terminoloogiaga

learning_outcomes.en: 4) have experience in practical criticism and in presenting their results orally and in writing.
learning_outcomes.et: 4) on harjutanud iseseisvat kirjandusteaduslikku uurimistööd ning selle vormistamist suuliselt ja kirjalikult.

description.et: Students must be prepared to participate in class discussions. Specific assignments will be given for each seminar. Active participation in class discussions will account for 60% of the grade.

Students will write an essay of 5-6 pages. The essay must be appropriately formatted and follow the requirements set for student papers in the style sheet (https://www.maailmakeeled.ut.ee/sites/default/files/www_ut/guidelines_style_sheet.pdf)
The essay will give 40% of the grade.

grade_preconditions.et: Regular attendance throughout the term (at least 75%) and participation in seminar discussions.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
